intro: Psychotria rigida var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent tubular corolla. The plant is often found in association with epiphytic growth, thriving on the trunks and branches of trees in humid environments.
